question: In 2009, one nation decided to rename its highest point (Boggy Peak) after the former US President Barack Obama. What is the name of that nation?
explanation: In 2009, Antigua and Barbuda decided to rename its highest peak (Boggy Peak) after the former US President Barack Obama as Mount Obama to celebrate his birthday. But after seven years in 2016, the government decided to rename again back to its old name, Boggy Peak. It measures 402 meters high.
